skill.name: meeting-insights-analyzer
skill.description: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, and actionable feedback. Identifies when you avoid conflict, use filler words, dominate conversations, or miss opportunities to listen. Perfect for professionals seeking to improve their communication and leadership skills.
skill.summary: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only text instructions for analyzing meeting transcripts. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or external commands. The 29 static findings are false positives triggered by Markdown syntax and JSON metadata fields. All file access is user-initiated and limited to files the user explicitly provides.

content.user_title: Analyze Meeting Transcripts for Communication Insights
content.value_statement: Meeting transcripts contain valuable feedback about communication patterns that most people never see. This skill reads your transcripts and identifies specific behaviors like conflict avoidance, filler words, interruptions, and listening habits with concrete examples and improvement suggestions.
actual_capabilities: Identifies conflict avoidance patterns with specific transcript quotes
Calculates speaking ratios and turn-taking statistics
Detects filler words and hedging language patterns
Evaluates active listening behaviors and questions
Analyzes leadership and facilitation style with examples
Compares communication patterns across multiple meetings over time
limitations: Requires pre-existing meeting transcript files to analyze
Does not transcribe audio or video recordings directly
Analysis quality depends on transcript accuracy and speaker labels
Cannot access live meeting feeds or real-time conversations

use_cases.title: Improve facilitation skills
use_cases.description: Analyze team meetings to understand how you include quiet members, handle disagreements, and balance speaking time.

use_cases.title: Track personal communication growth
use_cases.description: Compare quarterly transcripts to see measurable improvements in listening, questioning, and direct communication.

use_cases.title: Give data-driven feedback
use_cases.description: Provide team members with specific examples from their meetings to accelerate their communication development.

prompt_templates.title: Quick conflict analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all meeting transcripts in this folder and tell me every instance where I avoided giving direct feedback or addressed tension indirectly. Include the exact quotes and suggest better approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Speaking ratio check
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at my team meetings and calculate my speaking time percentage compared to other participants. Show me specific moments where I dominated conversations or interrupted others.

prompt_templates.title: Listening skills review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my meetings for active listening indicators: paraphrasing others ideas, asking clarifying questions, and building on previous contributions. Give me examples of both strong and weak listening moments.

prompt_templates.title: Monthly progress report
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my communication patterns from last month to this month. Track changes in interruptions, filler word usage, question-asking, and direct feedback delivery. Show specific examples of improvement.

output_examples.input: Analyze my meetings and tell me when I avoided conflict.
output: Found 23 instances across 15 meetings of indirect communication
Pattern 1: Hedging on critical feedback (8 times) with example quote showing uncertainty language
Pattern 2: Deflection at tense moments (6 times) when disagreements arose
Recommendation: Lead with the issue directly, remove hedging words like maybe and kind of
Statistics: You spoke 65% of time, asked 4 questions per meeting, used filler words 12 times per hour

output_examples.input: Analyze my speaking ratio in team meetings
output: Your speaking time: 60% of total meeting time across 12 meetings
Team average: 25% per person across 6 participants
Moments of dominance: Identified 7 instances where you spoke for more than 3 minutes continuously
Interruption pattern: 5 interruptions given, 2 received per meeting average
Recommendation: Pause after others speak, ask more open questions to encourage participation

output_examples.input: Compare my listening skills from last quarter to this quarter
output: Improvement: Clarifying questions increased from 2 to 7 per meeting (+250%)
Improvement: Interruptions decreased from 8 to 3 per meeting (-62%)
Strength: Building on others ideas now appears 4 times per meeting vs 1 previously
Remaining gap: Paraphrasing others statements remains low at 1 per meeting
Next focus area: Practice summarizing others key points before responding

best_practices: Store transcripts in a dedicated folder with consistent naming like YYYY-MM-DD - Meeting Name.txt
Run monthly analyses to track meaningful trends over time
Focus on one specific behavior at a time for deeper insights rather than broad analyses
anti_patterns: Asking for comprehensive analysis of all behaviors at once instead of focusing on specific areas
Analyzing low-quality transcripts without speaker labels or timestamps
Ignoring the specific quotes and examples provided in favor of abstract recommendations

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports txt, md, vtt, srt, and docx transcript files with speaker labels and timestamps.

faq.question: How many meetings can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: There is no strict limit. The skill works with any number of transcript files in a folder.

faq.question: Does this skill record or transcribe my meetings?
faq.answer: No. You must provide existing transcript files. The skill only reads files you explicitly share.

faq.question: Is my meeting data kept private?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis happens locally with files you provide. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my analysis missing some meetings?
faq.answer: Ensure transcripts have clear speaker labels and timestamps. Check that files are in the folder you specified.

faq.question: How is this different from AI meeting recording tools?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes text you already have. It focuses on behavioral patterns, not transcription or summarization.
